content.raw:
I believe it is a bit confusing because as this file it hosted on Bitbucket users have to clone using `hg clone`. But the actual `gazebo_ros_pkgs` are hosted on github. So, if a user tries to do `git clone`[https://bitbucket.org/snippets/chapulina/geRKyA/ros2repos-supplement-gazebo\_ros\_pkgs](https://bitbucket.org/snippets/chapulina/geRKyA/ros2repos-supplement-gazebo_ros_pkgs) this results an error.  I

thought a simple copying of contents in the file will be more straight forward to do. Moreover, the additional information on the `version` tag should able to point which branch the users are checking out. But if you think adding two separate installation steps will be more helpful, let me know. I will update accordingly.
content.html:
I believe it is a bit confusing because as this file it hosted on Bitbucket users have to clone using hg clone. But the actual gazebo_ros_pkgs are hosted on github. So, if a user tries to do git clonehttps://bitbucket.org/snippets/chapulina/geRKyA/ros2repos-supplement-gazebo_ros_pkgs this results an error. I

thought a simple copying of contents in the file will be more straight forward to do. Moreover, the additional information on the version tag should able to point which branch the users are checking out. But if you think adding two separate installation steps will be more helpful, let me know. I will update accordingly.
